Kemenhub Siap Dukung Kemudahan Aksesibilitas Destinasi 5 Bali Baru
07 Nov 2019, 23:18 by Uji Sukma Medianti
Jakarta - Kementerian Perhubungan siap mendukung kemudahan aksesibilitas pada kawasan destinasi wisata superprioritas 5 'Bali Baru' dengan mewujudkan konektivitas melalui berbagai pembangunan infrastruktur transportasi.
Hal ini disampaikan oleh Menteri Perhubungan dalam Forum Perhubungan dengan tema 'Melihat Kesiapan Infrastruktur Wujudkan Konektivitas di 5 Destinasi Wisata Bali Baru'.
"Kita diberi tugas untuk menyelesaikan yang namanya 5 Bali Baru yaitu Danau Toba, Borobudur, Mandalika, Labuan bajo, dan Likupang. Pemerintah tengah membangun banyak kawasan wisata, untuk itu kami akan mendukung dengan memadukan dengan membangun fasilitas pendukungnya yaitu infrastruktur sarana dan prasarana transportasi, agar kemudahan aksesibilitas itu terjadi di titik-titik wisata tersebut," kata Budi dalam keterangan tertulis, Kamis (7/11/2019).
Pariwisata merupakan salah satu sektor yang menjadi andalan sebagai sumber devisa bagi Indonesia yang terkenal akan keberagaman budaya dan keindahan alam. Oleh karena itu, Presiden Joko Widodo mengatakan percepatan pembangunan infrastruktur pendukung sangat diperlukan agar dapat segera mempromosikan 5 Bali baru secara masif pada dunia internasional mulai tahun 2020.
Di tahun 2020, Pemerintah menargetkan adanya peningkatan kunjungan jumlah wisatawan mancanegara (wisman) sampai dengan 18,5 juta orang per tahun dan pergerakan wisatawan nusantara mencapai 310 juta perjalanan per tahun dengan target penerimaan Devisa antara US$ 19-21 Miliar. Meningkatnya kedatangan turis mancanegara ke Indonesia diharapkan bisa meningkatkan pertumbuhan ekonomi di tengah defisit transaksi berjalan dan neraca perdagangan negara.
Untuk itu, Kementerian Perhubungan selaku Kementerian yang bertanggung jawab di bidang transportasi, melakukan upaya peningkatan konektivitas melalui pembangunan infrastruktur sarana dan prasarana transportasi, agar aksesibilitas semakin mudah dan pada ujungnya menarik atau mendatangkan banyak turis baik mancanegara maupun domestik.
"Pemerintahan Presiden Joko Widodo dan Wapres Maruf Amin telah menetapkan 5 destinasi pariwisata super prioritas yang akan dijadikan sebagai 'Bali baru'. Untuk itu kami ditugaskan untuk membangun berbagai infrastruktur transportasi seperti bandara, pelabuhan, Kapal dan fasilitas transporasi lainnya yang ditargetkan selesai pada tahun 2020 untuk mewujudkan konektivitas ke tempat destinasi wisata tersebut," jelasnya.
Pada tahun 2020, Kemenhub mengalokasikan anggaran sebesar Rp 2,95 triliun untuk melakukan peningkatan kapasitas dan aksesibilitas transportasi laut, darat, perkeretaapian, dan udara di 5 Kawasan Strategis Pariwisata Nasional (KSPN) tersebut dengan rincian, Rp 1,04 Triliun untuk KSPN Danau Toba, Rp 1,25 Triliun untuk KSPN Borobudur, Rp 40,3 Miliar untuk KSPN Mandalika, Rp 435,04 Miliar untuk KSPN Labuan Bajo dan Rp 129,89 Miliar untuk Destinasi Unggulan Likupang.
"Bapak Presiden meminta kami untuk memastikan apa yang kami bangun dan kembangkan itu bisa 'delivered' atau dirasakan langsung manfaatnya oleh masyarakat. Tentunya untuk mewujudkan itu, kami tidak bisa bekerja sendiri. Perlu kolaborasi dengan berbagai mitra kerja seperti : Kementerian Pariwisata, Kementerian PUPR, Kementerian BUMN dan melibatkan sektor swasta dalam pengembangan infrastruktur transportasi," tuturnya.

Sejumlah Proyek Infrastruktur Transportasi Dikerjakan

Kementerian Perhubungan telah melakukan perencanaan pembangunan dan rehabilitasi fasilitas transportasi di 5 Bali Baru. Seperti halnya Di Danau Toba, sejumlah infrastruktur transportasi telah dan akan dibangun yaitu melakukan pembangunan/rehabilitasi 12 Pelabuhan Danau, membuat satu kapal penyeberangan Ro-Ro dan satu unit Bus Air, menyubsidi operasional angkutan antarmoda, fasilitas integrasi angkutan jalan, peningkatan jalur KA lintas Araskabu - Tebing Tinggi - Siantar sepanjang 35 km'sp (SBSN), DED pembangunan jembatan dan sistem persinyalan dan telekomunikasi serta bangunan stasiun juga pembuatan runway strip tahap I Bandara Sibisa.
Di Borobudur, Kemenhub akan membangun jalur KA Solo Balapan Bandara Adi Soemarmo, membangun KA Bandara Yogyakarta Internasional Airport - Kulonprogo, elektrifikasi jalur KA lintas Yogyakarta-Solo, menyubsidi operasional angkutan antarmoda, fasilitas integrasi angkutan jalan, fasilitas perlengkapan jalan dan DED pembanguann jembatan dan sistem persinyalan dan telekomunikasi serta bangunan stasiun.
Sementara Kawasan Mandalika akan dilakukan pengadaan dan pemasangan perlengkapan jalan, perbaikan fasilitas integrasi angkutan jalan, membiayai subsidi operasional angkutan antaramoda di Mandalika, merehabilitasi Pelabuhan Pamenang, melanjutkan pembanguna Pelabuhan Faspel Gili Terawangan.
Destinasi Likupang akan dilakukan peningkatan fasilitas di Pelabuhan Likupang, membangun Kapal Bottom glass di Bunaken, merehabilitasi Pelabuhan Penyeberangan Likupang, merehabilitasi Pelabuhan Penyeberangan Lembeh. Terakhir di Labuan Bajo Kemenhub akan memberikan subsidi operasional antarmoda, memberikan fasilitas integrasi angkutan jalan, pengadaan 2 unit kapal bottom glass seperti di Likupang, melakukan pengembangan Terminal Kargo Pelabuhan Labuan Bajo, pembebasan lahan untuk pengembangan bandara, pemotongan bukit daerah transisional dan perpanjangan runway dari 2450 m x 45 m menjadi 2650 m x 45 m termasuk marking dan pengawasan.
"Tentunya pengembangan yang dilakukan tidak bisa hanya mengandalkan APBN tetapi juga perlu partisipasi sektor swasta nasional maupun asing. Seperti di Bandara Labuan Bajo, kami sedang lakukan kerjasama pengembangan infrastruktur bandara melalui skema Kerjasama Pemerintah dan Badan Usaha (KPBU) yang diminati sejumlah investor nasional maupun asing. Seperti diamanatkan bapak Presiden agar 5 Destinasi wisata bisa segera dipromosikan pada tahun 2020, fokus kami pada tahun 2020 adalah menyelesaikan target tersebut," pungkasnya.
Dalam forum ini turut hadir sebagai narasumber Sekretaris Jenderal Kementerian Perhubungan Djoko Sasono, Direktur Keterpaduan Infrastruktur Pemukiman Kementerian PUPR Edward Abdul Rahman, serta Asisten Deputi Pengembangan Infrastruktur dan Ekosistem Pariwisata Kementerian Pariwisata dan Ekonomi Kreatif Indra Ni Tua.

Ministry of Transportation Ready to Support the Ease of Accessibility of Destinations 5 of New Bali
Nov 7 2019, 23:18 by Sukma Medianti Test
Jakarta - The Ministry of Transportation is ready to support ease of accessibility to the 5 'Bali Baru' super-priority tourist destination area by realizing connectivity through various transportation infrastructure developments.
This was conveyed by the Minister of Transportation in the Transportation Forum with the theme 'Seeing Infrastructure Readiness to Realize Connectivity in 5 New Bali Tourism Destinations'.
"We are given the task to complete the 5 Bali New names namely Lake Toba, Borobudur, Mandalika, Labuan Bajo, and Likupang. The government is building many tourist areas, for that we will support by integrating with building supporting facilities namely infrastructure and transportation infrastructure, so that accessibility can occur at these tourist points, "Budi said in a written statement, Thursday (11/07/2019).
Tourism is one of the sectors that is a mainstay as a source of foreign exchange for Indonesia which is famous for its cultural diversity and natural beauty. Therefore, President Joko Widodo said the accelerated development of supporting infrastructure is needed so that it can immediately promote the 5 new Bali massively to the international world starting in 2020.
In 2020, the Government is targeting an increase in the number of foreign tourist arrivals (tourists) up to 18.5 million people per year and the movement of domestic tourists to reach 310 million trips per year with a target of foreign exchange receipts between US $ 19-21 billion. The increase in foreign tourist arrivals to Indonesia is expected to increase economic growth amid the current account deficit and the country's trade balance.
For this reason, the Ministry of Transportation, as the Ministry responsible for transportation, is making efforts to improve connectivity through the construction of transportation infrastructure and facilities, so that accessibility is easier and in the end attracts or attracts many foreign and domestic tourists.
"The administration of President Joko Widodo and Vice President Maruf Amin have set 5 super priority tourism destinations that will be made as 'new Bali'. For this reason we are tasked with building various transportation infrastructure such as airports, ports, ships and other transportation facilities which are targeted to be completed by 2020 to realize connectivity to the tourist destination, "he explained.
In 2020, the Ministry of Transportation allocated a budget of Rp 2.95 trillion to increase the capacity and accessibility of sea, land, rail and air transportation in the 5 National Tourism Strategic Areas (KSPN) with details, Rp 1.04 Trillion for Lake Toba KSPN , Rp. 1.25 Trillion for Borobudur KSPN, Rp. 40.3 Billion for Mandalika KSPN, Rp. 435.04 Billion for Labuan Bajo KSPN and Rp. 129.89 Billion for Likupang Leading Destinations.
"Mr. President asked us to ensure that what we build and develop can be 'delivered' or felt directly by the community. Of course, to realize that, we cannot work alone. We need collaboration with various working partners such as: Ministry of Tourism, Ministry of PUPR, The Ministry of BUMN and involving the private sector in the development of transportation infrastructure, "he said.

A number of Transportation Infrastructure Projects Are Done

The Ministry of Transportation has planned the construction and rehabilitation of transportation facilities in 5 Bali Baru. As in Lake Toba, a number of transportation infrastructures have been and will be built, namely undertaking construction / rehabilitation of 12 Lake Ports, making one Ro-Ro crossing ship and one Water Bus unit, subsidizing intermodal transport operations, road transport integration facilities, improving the Araskabu railroad. - Tebing Tinggi - Siantar along 35 km'sp (SBSN), DED construction of bridges and signaling and telecommunications systems and station buildings as well as the construction of phase I runway strips Sibisa Airport.
In Borobudur, the Ministry of Transportation will build the Solo Soekarno Airport Airport Railway, build the Yogyakarta International Airport - Kulonprogo Airport Railway, electrify the Yogyakarta-Solo railroad line, subsidize intermodal transport operations, road transport integration facilities, road equipment facilities and bridge DEDs and bridge development systems and systems signaling and telecommunications and station buildings.
While the Mandalika area will be procured and installed road equipment, improved road transport integration facilities, funded intermodal transport operational subsidies in Mandalika, rehabilitated the Pamenang Port, continued construction of the Gili Terawangan Faspel Port.
Destinations Likupang will be upgrading facilities at Likupang Port, building Bottom Glass Vessels in Bunaken, rehabilitating Likupang Crossing Ports, rehabilitating Lembeh Crossing Ports. Finally in Labuan Bajo the Ministry of Transportation will provide intermodal operational subsidies, provide road transport integration facilities, procure 2 units of bottom glass vessels such as in Likupang, develop the Labuan Bajo Port Cargo Terminal, land acquisition for airport development, transitional area hill cutting and runway extension from 2450 mx 45 m to 2650 mx 45 m including marking and supervision.
"Certainly the development carried out can not only rely on the state budget but also requires the participation of national and foreign private sectors. Like at Labuan Bajo Airport, we are conducting cooperation in developing airport infrastructure through the Government and Business Entity (PPP) scheme which is in demand by a number of national and foreign investors "As mandated by the President so that 5 tourist destinations can be promoted immediately in 2020, our focus in 2020 is to complete the target," he concluded.
In this forum also present as a guest speaker Secretary General of the Ministry of Transportation Djoko Sasono, Director of Settlement Infrastructure Integrity of the Ministry of PUPR Edward Abdul Rahman, and Assistant Deputy of Infrastructure and Tourism Ecosystem Development of the Ministry of Tourism and Creative Economy Indra Ni Tua.
